articles.author: Thomas Franck
articles.title: Online brokerage stocks sink on JP Morgan's plan to offer free trading
articles.description: Online brokerage firms including Charles Schwab, TD Ameritrade and E-Trade sank on Wall Street Tuesday after CNBC reported that J.P. Morgan Chase will offer a free trading service.

articles.title: China's biggest risk may be its property market — not the trade war

articles.author: Liz Moyer
articles.title: China central bank official rebuts Trump's claim it is manipulating the yuan
articles.description: A senior official of the People's Bank of China told a briefing on Tuesday that the yuan's exchange rate is set by the market, rebutting President Trump's claim a day earlier that the country was manipulating its currency.

articles.title: European markets seen lower after Trump comments; US-China trade talks in focus
articles.description: European stocks are set to open lower Tuesday morning, as comments from President Donald Trump weigh on the dollar and test market optimism ahead of U.S.-China trade talks.

articles.description: Trump plan rolls back Obama's coal emissions standards.

articles.author: By MATTHEW DALY Associated Press
articles.title: Trump plan rolls back Obama's coal emissions standards
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Trump administration is set to roll back the centerpiece of President Barack Obama's efforts to slow global warming, the Clean Power Plan that restricts greenhouse gas emissions from coal-fired power plants.

articles.title: Image-conscious China appoints new global propaganda czar
articles.description: BEIJING (AP) — China's increasingly image-conscious government has appointed a trusted member of the ruling Communist Party to head up its international propaganda operation.

articles.title: Vietnam puts 12 people on trial for alleged subversion
articles.description: HANOI, Vietnam (AP) — A court in Vietnam's Ho Chi Minh City on Tuesday began the trial of 12 people, including two American citizens, on subversion charges as government authorities step up a crackdown on dissent.
